headline: Darden Restaurants, Conagra Brands, Dollar Tree: Trending tickers
summary: Wealth host Brad Smith breaks down the latest news on Yahoo Finance's top trending tickers. Darden Restaurants (DRI) shares climbed after the company topped fiscal second quarter earnings expectations, with a strong performance from Olive Garden and LongHorn Steakhouse driving revenue and profit. The restaurant group also raised its full-year 2024 sales forecast. Conagra Brands (CAG) stock declined after the snack maker's decision to reduce its guidance. The company cited persistent inflation and challenging foreign exchange rates as key challenges. Meanwhile, Dollar Tree (DLTR) has appointed Michael Creedon as its new CEO. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here. This post was written by Angel Smith

headline: Dollar Tree Appoints Its Third CEO in 2 Years
summary: Former COO Michael Creedon will become the retailer’s third chief executive in the span of two years.

headline: Dollar Tree Names Michael Creedon Jr. Permanent CEO
summary: Dollar Tree said it has named Michael Creedon Jr. as the discount retailer’s permanent chief executive, removing the interim tag he has carried since early November.

raw.headline: Dollar Tree Names Michael Creedon Jr. Permanent CEO
raw.summary: Dollar Tree said it has named Michael Creedon Jr. as the discount retailer’s permanent chief executive, removing the interim tag he has carried since early November.

headline: Dollar Tree names Michael Creedon permanent CEO
summary: Creedon, the retailer’s chief operating officer, has been serving as interim chief since November and takes the helm as it navigates several major initiatives.

raw.headline: Dollar Tree names Michael Creedon permanent CEO
raw.summary: Creedon, the retailer’s chief operating officer, has been serving as interim chief since November and takes the helm as it navigates several major initiatives.

headline: Dollar Tree names Michael Creedon as permanent CEO to steer turnaround
summary: Creedon, who worked at auto parts retailer Advance Auto Parts for nearly a decade before joining Dollar Tree in 2022, was named interim CEO last month.  Dollar Tree's shares were up 2% in premarket trading on Thursday.  The Chesapeake, Virginia-headquartered company launched a turnaround effort this year that involved shutting 970 Family Dollar stores and exploring options, including a possible sale for the banner.

headline: Dollar Tree Names Michael C. Creedon, Jr. as Chief Executive Officer
summary: CHESAPEAKE, Va., December 19, 2024--Dollar Tree, Inc. (NASDAQ: DLTR) today announced that its Board of Directors has appointed Interim CEO Michael C. Creedon, Jr. as permanent Chief Executive Officer.
